title: eyethinkdata_vignette
text: toolbox behavioural data. processes raw downloads gorilla, preps behavioural datas analysis extracts scores information questionnaires. Performs basic plotting RDIs (pirate plots), correlations raw data ANOVAs mixed models. ’s get latest version toolbox

title: eyethinkdata_vignette
text: several functions beginning data_ read multiple data files merge R object. commonly used data_collator_gorilla(). pass name folder contains downloads gorilla. downloads can .zip files unzipped folders contain gorilla .csv files. look like folders run function, tell name folder contains downloaded items, leave blank OS ask choose folder. Remember give function folder contains folders raw data . now list called data contains several data.tables. data$data_task contains data gorilla tasks, blue blobs experiment. raw data gorilla collated together, columns added. example, pid participant identity (anonymised). rt reaction time column. another data.table called data\(data_q** info experiment questionnaires. Note download data, choose long format. Finally, used mouse eye tracking plugins, data **data\)data_continuous

title: eyethinkdata_vignette
text: ’re going extract, plot analyse data example IAT experiment. first step analysing data pick rows columns want experiment. ’s filter important data Now can plot data generic ploting function, mypirate. name columns/conditions want plot x axis, colour contrast.  Since dot per trial, bit crowded. can first average people, also turn elements mypirate. set options flip coordinates  connect conditions lines  can analyse data afex aov_ex package, plot results plot_model(). output ANOVA table means tables main effects interactions, shows post hoc results comparing effects first named condition levels second.    IAT function processing analyis ’ve done one functions package score standard questionnaires, explore plot correlation. want documented, raise issue github!
code: iat_data <-  data$data_task[metadata %in% c("congruent","incongruent") & Attempt==1 & display=="trials",  # row selection                                    .(pid, trial=Trial.Number, congruency=metadata,accuracy=Correct,rt,                # columns                                          item=paste0(na.omit(ImageCentre),na.omit(TextCentre)))]                   # stimulus idea # figure out what block came first for each person iat_data[,firstblock:=.SD[c(1)]$congruency,by=pid]  knitr::kable(head(iat_data)) mypirate(data=iat_data[accuracy==1 & rt<2000], # trim incorrect trials and outliers          colour_condition = "congruency",x_condition = "firstblock",dv = "rt") mypirate(data=iat_data[accuracy==1 & rt<2000],          colour_condition = "congruency",x_condition = "firstblock",dv = "rt",pid_average = T,          violin = F,bar=T,cflip = T)  # no dots but draw some bars mypirate(data=iat_data[accuracy==1 & rt<2000],          colour_condition = "congruency",x_condition = "firstblock",dv = "rt",          dots=F,line=T,violin=F)  # no dots but draw some bars anv <- afex::aov_ez(data=iat_data[accuracy==1 & rt<2000],fun_aggregate = mean,                     id="pid",between="firstblock",within="congruency",dv="rt")  plot_model(anv,outp = NULL,bars=F) # you can pass mypirate parameters to this function as above ##  ## Univariate Type III Repeated-Measures ANOVA Assuming Sphericity ##  ##                         Sum Sq num Df Error SS den Df  F value  Pr(>F)     ## (Intercept)           34517501      1  1727205     26 519.5995 < 2e-16 *** ## firstblock               26906      1  1727205     26   0.4050 0.53007     ## congruency               87704      1   223885     26  10.1851 0.00368 **  ## firstblock:congruency     8705      1   223885     26   1.0109 0.32396     ## --- ## Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ##  ##  ## Main effects of  congruency  ##  congruency  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent      825 38.0 26      747      903 ##  incongruent    913 42.9 26      825     1001 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: firstblock  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  contrast                estimate   SE df t.ratio p.value ##  congruent - incongruent    -87.6 27.4 26  -3.191  0.0037 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: firstblock ##  ##  ## Main effects of  firstblock  ##  firstblock  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent      893 40.8 26      809      977 ##  incongruent    845 64.4 26      712      977 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: congruency  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  contrast                estimate   SE df t.ratio p.value ##  congruent - incongruent     48.5 76.2 26   0.636  0.5301 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: congruency ##  ##  ## Interactions of  congruency firstblock  ##  congruency  firstblock  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent   congruent      836 40.6 26      752      919 ##  incongruent congruent      951 45.9 26      856     1045 ##  congruent   incongruent    815 64.2 26      683      947 ##  incongruent incongruent    875 72.6 26      726     1024 ##  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  contrast                                        estimate   SE df t.ratio ##  congruent congruent - incongruent congruent       -115.2 29.3 26  -3.926 ##  congruent congruent - congruent incongruent         20.9 75.9 26   0.276 ##  congruent congruent - incongruent incongruent      -39.1 83.1 26  -0.470 ##  incongruent congruent - congruent incongruent      136.1 78.9 26   1.726 ##  incongruent congruent - incongruent incongruent     76.1 85.8 26   0.887 ##  congruent incongruent - incongruent incongruent    -60.0 46.4 26  -1.293 ##  p.value ##   0.0030 ##   0.9925 ##   0.9650 ##   0.3312 ##   0.8117 ##   0.5753 ##  ## P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 4 estimates ## $model_summary ##  ## Univariate Type III Repeated-Measures ANOVA Assuming Sphericity ##  ##                         Sum Sq num Df Error SS den Df  F value  Pr(>F)     ## (Intercept)           34517501      1  1727205     26 519.5995 < 2e-16 *** ## firstblock               26906      1  1727205     26   0.4050 0.53007     ## congruency               87704      1   223885     26  10.1851 0.00368 **  ## firstblock:congruency     8705      1   223885     26   1.0109 0.32396     ## --- ## Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ##  ## $means_congruency ##  congruency  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent      825 38.0 26      747      903 ##  incongruent    913 42.9 26      825     1001 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: firstblock  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  ## $plot_congruency ##  ## $means_firstblock ##  firstblock  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent      893 40.8 26      809      977 ##  incongruent    845 64.4 26      712      977 ##  ## Results are averaged over the levels of: congruency  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  ## $plot_firstblock ##  ## $means_congruency_firstblock ##  congruency  firstblock  emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL ##  congruent   congruent      836 40.6 26      752      919 ##  incongruent congruent      951 45.9 26      856     1045 ##  congruent   incongruent    815 64.2 26      683      947 ##  incongruent incongruent    875 72.6 26      726     1024 ##  ## Confidence level used: 0.95  ##  ## $plot_congruency_firstblock gorilla_iatanalysis(data)

title: Outputs a pirate plot (RDI) — mypirate
code: mypirate(   data,   colour_condition = NULL,   x_condition = "variable",   facet_condition = NULL,   facet_scales = "fixed",   pid_average = F,   dv,   reorder = F,   pid = "pid",   dodgewidth = 0.8,   plot_condition = NULL,   cond = NULL,   cond2 = NULL,   facetby = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   xlim = NULL,   w = NULL,   h = 6,   title = NULL,   outp = "analysis",   cols = NULL,   pred_line = F,   error_bar_data = NULL,   pred = NULL,   pred_means = NULL,   pred_bar = T,   xlabs = NULL,   xlabpos = 1.1,   error_data = NULL,   cflip = F,   norm = F,   bars = F,   violin = T,   dots = T,   splitV = F,   svw = 1,   dot_h_jitter = 0,   line = F,   error_bars = T,   useall = F,   legend = T,   title_overide = F,   combine_plots = list(),   combine_position = "right",   elementinc = NULL,   ... )

title: Outputs a pirate plot (RDI) — mypirate
text: data data one person per line, excluding rows use=0 colour_condition colour split x_condition x axis split (, specified colour condition used x axis ) facet_condition faceting pid_average plot average participant's dv named conditions dv name single dv column, multiple columns, case split x_condition unless colour facet condition set 'variable' pid whats name col identifies individuals plot_condition instead passing individually, can give vector 3 cols specify colours use error_data distribution mean, eg Bayes analysis, replace SE cflip flip horizontal plot norm normalise / z-score values comparison across scales useall ignore use column plot rows
